ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Improved my understanding of Portuguese vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation through interactive assignments designed to expose students to culture

I feel like such a better Portuguese speaker and reader after this class. Especially with grammar stuff that I struggle with. Professor XGP is excellent at making Portuguese fun. I also learned so much about culture in Brazil which was awesome.
I developed a good understanding of the past tense and a little of the future tense in Portuguese while expanding my vocabulary
I learned a lot of the next steps of Portuguese and had a good time doing it in an engaging class environment.
Knowledge of Portuguese language and culture
I have acquired more Portuguese vocabulary and am able to speak more naturally.
We learned the different forms of past tense and a future tense. Overall, I saw general improvement in my reading, writing, speaking ability, and especially listening comprehension.
how to speak read write and understand the language
Portuguese! I learned so much of the language in one short semester.
Knowledge of Portuguese language and Brazilian culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class is organized in such a fun way! Its so engaging and exciting compared to other language classes at Yale!

Strengths: it is impossible not to learn a ton, homework in manageable, Professor XGP is wonderful, material makes learning Portuguese fun

Weaknesses: none, I wouldn't change a thing about the course!
I felt like the topics that we covered helped facilitate each unit very well but sometimes the homework felt like busy work.

The strengths are the all the different way the language is taught either through movies, books, and more. The weaknesses is that the class similar to other languages involves a lot of discussion and meets 4 days a week, so it can be taxing.

Strengths - Teacher was kind, showed genuine care for her students. Class atmosphere was conducive to learning in a fun environment.

Weakness - Teacher should talk more in English so class is easier to understand, more formal grammar and vocabulary lectures would be helpful
This course is awesome. The original curriculum really helps you learn how to speak and write and portuguese and helps you learn more about Brazilian culture.

Strengths: The Professor is fantastic. The entire course was created using original and gathered material. The class isn't constrained by a textbook so a large portion of the course involves interacting with Portuguese through different cultural lenses.
Weaknesses: Especially towards the beginning of the semester, I felt there was a lack of grammar exercises that prevented me from having a scaffolding to build off of.  The syllabus was often incorrect which made planning around other courses complicated.
sometimes the assignments feel like busy work but the overall design of the course is unique and engaging
This course was so fun! The professor was great, homework was engaging, and the projects were always so enjoyable.
Strengths: Very chilled and flexible in assignments. Weaknesses: Not a lot of rigor and did not really teach us Portuguese.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes!
YES! If you are deciding on what language to take at Yale, I STRONGLY recommend Portuguese!
Yes, Portuguese is a great language to learn and the class makes doing it super fun and easy.
I definitely would as it is a very interesting language that is not too difficult to learn.
Absolutely
Yes, even if you dont need this class for a language requirement, it is amazing!
Yes, I would definitely recommend to anyone looking to complete their language requirement that has an interest in Lusophone culture.
Yes
yes! If you want to learn more Portuguese you absolutely should.
Yes! Fun way to learn a language. I will say it is not the most rewarding if you really want to learn Portuguese, but it is a fun way to meet people and learn something fun.
